  • Uses of Field in arb

    Classes in arb that implement Field
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Complex
    The complex numbers constitute an algebraically closed field, a commutative algebra over the reals, and a Euclidean vector space of dimension two.
    class 
    Real
    Real numbers are points on an infinitely long line known as the real number line, where the points corresponding to integers are equally spaced.

  • Uses of Field in arb.spaces

    Classes in arb.spaces with type parameters of type Field
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    HardySpace<D extends Field,F extends Function<D,?>>
    A Hardy space is a HilbertSpace with inner product given by
    (𝑓|𝑔)=sup{0<𝑟<1}(∫(𝑓(𝑟*exp(𝑖*𝜃))*conj(𝑔(𝑟*exp(𝑖*𝜃)))d𝜃=0..2π))
    interface 
    HilbertSpace<D extends Field,F extends Function<D,?>>
    Hilbert spaces (named after David Hilbert) allow generalizing the methods of linear algebra and calculus from (finite-dimensional) Euclidean vector spaces to spaces that may be infinite-dimensional.
